title: Can someone explain why i got a 25 chat ban for this
body:
Game 1
Killsquad2: go afk
Killsquad2: yep
Killsquad2: 9x on him after
Killsquad2: hes been feeding already
Killsquad2: no
Killsquad2: no you didnt
Killsquad2: youre just making excuses to be bat at he game
Killsquad2: keep talking
Killsquad2: so you get perma banned
Killsquad2: varus
Killsquad2: do you really think i just sat top and stole all his farm?
Killsquad2: guys
Killsquad2: im going to surrender at 20
Killsquad2: this games over
Killsquad2: varus
Killsquad2: it is over
Killsquad2: shaco has inted on top lane twice
Killsquad2: mid lane twice
Killsquad2: and bot lane
Killsquad2: on top of that he has let a nasus free farm
Killsquad2: i know you want to keep trying but this game is over bud
Killsquad2: how much cs does shaco have?
Killsquad2: k
Killsquad2: just gonna keep hard farming then
Killsquad2: yea
Killsquad2: games over
Killsquad2: i want to go to bed
Killsquad2: plase say yet
Killsquad2: yes
Killsquad2: bro
Killsquad2: ok
Killsquad2: well
Killsquad2: im out
Killsquad2: like idk why you wanted to be a child about it
Killsquad2: shaco has been inting for 20 mins
Killsquad2: and you have been oblivious to it
Killsquad2: but this games over
Killsquad2: no
Killsquad2: janna
Killsquad2: kat?
Killsquad2: like a  little back up here?
Killsquad2: yo
Killsquad2: can you guys please end
Killsquad2: team thinks we are going to win some how with an inting shaco
Killsquad2: just please end this as they wont surrender
Killsquad2: no varus' words were "you fucked us now you stay
Killsquad2: so im just ready to end this pain
Killsquad2: thats fine just report both of them
Killsquad2: i want this shaco banned

Someone help me out on how i got chat banned here? im really confused on why having a conversation in game got me chat banned.

replies.body:
The thread has devolved into nothing but insults and arguing, and for those reasons I'll be locking this discussion. In the future please keep the comments more thoughtful to other players.

If you have any questions about this moderation action, don't hesitate to reach out to the Boards Moderation Team via:
The [Boards Moderation Discord](https://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/community-moderation/qVlculPP-boards-moderation-discord)

Your Shaco started off giving up a few deaths, so you spent the entire fucking game harassing him, insulting him, pressuring him to go AFK, threatening him with reports, etc. 

It's not particularly relevant how badly the Shaco was feeding, because your logs ensured that this would be a toxic game. This is a straightforward abuse of the chat system. Next time either play nice, or shut up. 

You said it best:
>Killsquad2: like idk why you wanted to be a child about it

this is pure ignorance in a post. i didnt spend the entire game flaming him i spent the entire game hard farming because i could do nothing for 20 mins but watch as he died intentionally 5 times at 8 mins... asking my team to surrender so we can end the game as fast as possible to get onto a game we can win is called discussion. if youre to childish to have a discussion i dont think you should be playing a game that has chat interaction.

the comment on its not relevant how badly the shaco was feeding.... like pure stupidity. it is 100% relevant because it made the game impossible to win. how is that not relevant?

It's relevant because a player being shit doesn't give you the right to flame them, and a player trolling you means flaming them actively rewards and encourages them. There's no good reason to flame. 

Call me ignorant all you like, but my account is in goo standing and you're on strike 2. The next time you decide that it's your God-given duty to clog your chat log by informing somebody how bad they are at the game over and over until everybody is pissed off and tired, you'll earn yourself a 14-day ban. Alternatively, you can take my advice and avoid all that. I'd encourage you to do so, rather than risk further action against your account. 

Let me be clear: Even if your version of events is accurate and this Shaco did *intentionally* feed kills, your response is still not proper. And I'm not convinced that is what happened here.
since youre a god-given duty bound assumptous a-hole here is the proof bud. https://www.twitch.tv/videos/225908929 game starts at 3 hours and inting starts at 3:05

Providing this video in the OP would have helped this discussion. You have to respect that most people bitching about "inting" on the boards are just salty that their teammates are under-performing. 

I will accept that the shaco was inting (at least the first death, I'm having a weird laggy time with Twitch so I only watched as far as that). That still means that you fed the troll, which is a big no-no, resulting in emboldening that player and opening yourself up to punishment by the system. The best reaction is always to simply mute, report, and move on.

While I do still think you didn't handle this game well, I apologize for suggesting that you were mis-representing the Shaco's performance. Based on your op.gg page, it looked like a simple bad game that you lost your cool over, but in the video the intent is clear. **I'm sorry, both for my own reaction and for the experience you went through.**

For what it's worth, you can try a support ticket to argue mitigating circumstances leading to you being baited into a chat restriction. The odds aren't really in your favor, though. Riot's policy, which is certainly imperfect but also difficult to improve on, is that there's no acceptable circumstances for flaming your team, period. Understand that many other players will insist, with as much conviction as you have here, that their bad teammates are "inting". Allowing subjective interpretation of intent between players to govern who "deserves" to be yelled at in chat is unrealistic.

all good man i can understand that. ive seen the posts on here and ive posted those on here myself. this game is extremely frustrating and it gets worse when simple communication leads to chat restriction. im not sure why chat is even in the game at this point since it seems automatic bans are put in place for simple discussions. especially since the game was OBVIOUSLY not going to be a win it turns into 20 mins of talking.

I think the crux of the issue is that "discussion" isn't a realistic goal in the middle of a game of League. Attention should be on the gameplay, not on who is doing what wrong.

You'll be totally fine going forward if you limit your use of chat to strategic calls or positive banter. Occasional light taunts at the enemy team are fine, too. Just avoid feeding the trolls. Remember that multiple reports are redundant, so establishing an 9x report and/or campaigning to draw attention to somebody's misbehavior accomplishes nothing, and often is seen as harassment.

but that wasnt a game of league of legends. thats the point the game was over at 4 mins into the game... literally had nothing to do but sit there and talk because the game cant end till 20 mins. Also how is taunting the enemy team considered ok but asking your team to end the game because the odds are stacked against us toxic?

Personally, when I have an actual intentional feeder on my team, I ignore them and focus on my own role. Honestly, I've had games where they stop feeding and we actually win. It's not common, to be sure, but it happens. After all, the fun of trolling your team is to provoke responses from them. If a troll doesn't get those responses, for many, there's no fun to be had. At that point, some will just start playing the game honestly. I still report them after the game, of course.

By "taunting" the enemy team, I mean stuff like "gotcha" or "outplayed" when you do something huge in a fight. Simple and non-insulting stuff, and only once in a while. I don't mean harassing or needless unsportsmanlike conduct, like COD or Halo chat.

i mean larger and better organizations like the NFL dont allow that kind of taunting but league of legends does? they also allow people to ruin the game along with banning people over calling those people out. im pretty sure riot is a horrible company and has poor rules and regulations if the NFL down to toddler flag football has a better policy on the issues. Yes this is the internet, but the way this is handled is cheap and ineffective especially since you can just make another account.

as for focusing on my role i asked my team to FF and the varus responded with no lets win ignore the shaco at which point i said ok ill keep hard farming. That was the conversation that follows. Unfortunately i got chat banned and nothing happened to the shaco that 100% made that game a loss. Since riot decides not to put time stamps its hard to tell what happened. im pretty sure that you can tell at this point that i can type more than the few lines of the in game chat in 24 minutes. there were a few broken up conversations asking people to surrender at every single lost team fight not consistent negative banter.

Killsquad2: this games over
Killsquad2: varus
Killsquad2: it is over
Killsquad2: shaco has inted on top lane twice
Killsquad2: mid lane twice
Killsquad2: and bot lane
Killsquad2: on top of that he has let a nasus free farm
Killsquad2: i know you want to keep trying but this game is over bud
Killsquad2: how much cs does shaco have?
Killsquad2: k
Killsquad2: just gonna keep hard farming then

automated system picks up on a number of things, including length of chat, and any use of low toxicity words regardless of context (words like "afk, useless, report, bad, INT, FF, GG, etc etc etc) .  It seems to add weight how many times you use the low toxicity trigger words.  So long chats are more likely to trigger.  The only reasonable solution is to not type.  As you can see "any evidence of negative behavior" will be hindsight supported by this community as a valid report.  So you will almost never get a ban over-turned even if its a VERY MILD toxic chat log.  Just remember its fully automated, and you have no recourse once the system flags you for a ban.  Also, there is ZERO interest in changing the system here.

The "zero interest" in changing the system on these boards stems from the fact that, in most cases, proposed changes are poorly thought-out or downright ignorant.

If you have a good idea, by all means, share it. The system has changed a lot over the years, and will continue to learn behavior and improve.
No thanks.  your use of the word "improved" triggered my automatic laugh out loud system.
Hey, I'm here to actually discuss things. If you'd rather score cheap points, you do you, but you might find better targets than me.

LOL!  Buddy I've been around a long time.  You are constantly white knighting. 

 So making a joke out of the ridiculous comment that the behavior system is improving, is just a nice way to end the conversation without actually being mean.

Your name doesn't ring a bell, and like 50% of the people on these boards I get a 404 when I try to check your post history, so you'll have to forgive me if we've had a similar discussion before. 

And I dunno, there's not much discussion value around here other than "white-knighting" or joining into the banned-player circle-jerk. Personally, with as much empathy and as much of an open mind as I am capable of, I generally agree with, or at least understand, each toxicity punishment that I see.

i think by improving you mean automating. there is not improvement of the system here at all. from what i have seen of the system it basically punishes everyone. that isnt really a good system that is just a cheap solution. as with most things in life if you go with a cheap product you usually get cheap results.

I can't speak to the cost associated with different kinds of behavioral systems.

Regarding automation vs. personal, it's a matter of efficiency. The IFS will instantly jump on somebody breaking the rules, with consistent accuracy, as opposed to the old Tribunal, which was slow. With so many people playing the game, and so many mis-uses of the report system, I think it's fair to say that using real people to evaluate each case is unrealistic. There'd be too much backlog. 

I do know, however, that the IFS system is a learning program that is based in a large part on the findings of the old Tribunal, as well as learning over time what is or is not acceptable behavior based on what is reported. For example, treating "kill yourself" with zero tolerance is a relatively newer feature of the system, based on community feedback.

funny cause i get told that pretty regularly. as for having people check all the report and games it isnt unrealistic its just costly. Riot would rather spend money on LCS than on improving the community of their game. the real money maker here is LCS not you and me and this forum and any of the bronze, silver, gold, plat, diamond, masters players. Only the challenger series, academy and LCS make them money outside of the game and since people STILL buy skins and champions with real money there is no problem with their business model. hence why they choose to not improve their community because it wont make them more money. its business 101.

Costly and unrealistic, in business, are two sides of the same coin. And since Riot believes their IFS system to be adequate in governing the behavior of the community, hiring and training a small army of people to manually review reports is a superfluous cost in their eyes.

Let's use your experience as an example. To you, your chat logs are justified by the misbehavior of your teammate. In a perfect worth with an impartial judge expertly analyzing your game, this would probably be true. However, we're putting that decision in the hands of a random Riot employee tasked with looking at these games all day every day, leaving room for error in that individual's interpretation, level of engagement, energy, degree of training, etc. If official Riot policy remains that flaming is never acceptable, your ass is still getting that chat restriction. If there's leniency available when dealing with trolls, then this random intern is not only tasked with evaluating your logs, but *also* the Shaco's behavior, and then making another subjective interpretation of how bad Shaco's behavior was, relative to how bad yours was. I can't imagine any level of consistency or accuracy being maintained in such a system. 

In googling around, I found that about 27 million people played League per day in 2014. I can't find any more recent figures, but if we just punt and half that number, we're still at 13.5 million people per day. What sort of army does Riot need on payroll to evaluate the reports sent by all those people manually? Seems catastrophically complex and time consuming.

if you cant get people to do it you shouldnt have a robot doing it. simple as that. i mean lets relate this to any other situation and lets say one of the same size. there are 330 million people in america so why not have computers analyze and give out tickets for any and all possible offense along with installing cameras across then entire US to make that happen? why not have them analyze data instead of judges since most cases are by facts and not by emotions? why? because its wrong. just because you feel its best doesnt make it right. this system is majorly flawed and punishes in my experience the wrong people. i have been reporting people for 3 years and ive seen probably 50 punishment messages. Now im not going to say every and im not going to say most games in general, but im MOST like 90% of my games there are toxic, flaming, inting players. so if your system is so good how come more people are not chat banned and/or perma banned? because they system doesnt work. the system only forces people to not communicate via chat and instead suggests all communication can be done through pings. I support that! so why can i completely disable team chat? because riots real goal is to ban accounts and have people repurchase skins, champions, rune pages, ect with a new account.

Youre trying to defend a flawed system because its ok. the real problem is riot is about making money and they actively ban people to force them to repurchase what they lost.

>the real problem is riot is about making money and they actively ban people to force them to repurchase what they lost.

Take a shot every time people use this excuse.
business 101. dont make a product that never needs to be replaced. why do you think everything is disposable now? loser comment again though
i think you missed the post buddy im the OP. literally my thread and my discussion. youre the one missing it.
You uh, missed the post by a bit. In any case, let's say I am. What's **internet** 101?

kind of like your argument, or statement, or mmmm actually im not sure what youre here for? o wait trolling! thats right and guess what riot wont ever ban you for that so feel free to waste your life away.

>business 101

That is a terrible business practice.

Nah dude, you're losing me. Automation and mass production are cornerstones of the modern world. There's no grand conspiracy at work here. Riot has a straightforward and simple code of conduct that you're expected to follow, and the IFS has a pretty easy time determining whether or not somebody is in violation of that code.

if you think that then i completely disagree. maybe you have never dealt with a real riot employee who reviews these cases because i have. they literally have said chat is not a good form of communication and shouldnt be used as pings can communicate everything that needs to be said. they have also said that the ToS specifically state that any behavior that they determine to be against their ToS can and will be punished. that basically says that it isnt a clear and defined code of conduct but rather a popularity contest.

as far as mass production and automation being cornerstones of the modern world take a look around you. automation and mass production are actually killing the work force and there are serious studies being done to figure out what to do with people when mass production and automation make a majority of the working population obsolete. its actually killing out world.

thats really sad... i appreciate that though and it makes more sense. thank you for the explanation. i guess i just mute and move chat off screen to ignore everyone all together... kinda sad that the thing that is supposed to make the community come together just divides people completely.
So you WERE looking for people to agree with you instead of having a discussion.
please explain. i dont usually follow stupidity.
And this is what your posts are devolving into. You disagree with someone? CLEARLY it's because they're of infeeior intelect.

no, but you're clearly of lower intellect since you cant even use auto correct. please learn to follow a topic im actually agreeing with the fucking person on this specific thread. jesus you fucking trolls are pissing me off. go do something with your life like pick up a book and gain some knowledge. start with a dictionary
Dude got trolled and lost his cool. I'm down to cut some slack here.
you probably got reported for a negative attitude. If i had been on your team id have reported you too. The stuff you were saying was unhelpful and annoying.

i mean youre bronze then... if you enjoy playing games just to lose please stay out of ranked. im not trying to be mean but im trying to get better and climb the ladders. this attitude of im going to play no matter how far behind we are is conductive to low winnings and less games. since climbing is a matter of more games and consistent wins i do like to FF at 20 when we have an intentional feeder.

1. Don't rank shame other's here on the boards. It isn't productive and it derails discussion.

2. You completely missed their point. Your attitude in that chat sucked. There are other ways to deal with a losing game that don't involve constant complaining and blaming. Most players would report that sort of behavior regardless of whether they want to continue playing a losing match or not.

ok how about this one. youre a loser. grow up and get a real life. better? now why dont you stop being a troll and actually contribute instead of making stupid comments that are not related to the OP. thanks

I'm not trying to antagonize you, I'm trying to prevent a pointless argument between you and Common Satyr. Don't insult others, it's pointless and only makes you look bad.

Setting your insults aside, I feel your pain. I know it sucks to lose honor and be punished when it doesn't feel fair. The thing is, anytime we do something we think is right and something happens to us we will think it is unfair, even if it actually was fair.

If you wish to avoid future punishments, don't be passive aggressive in chat with teammates. Don't point fingers in chat when things go wrong, and don't repeatedly ask people to surrender. If the surrender vote fails the first time then your team has already spoken. It's not your place or right to force your will on the majority and force them to give up when they don't want to.

If you can learn these things then you will likely avoid future chat restrictions, if you disregard them and continue doing them then you will likely acquire future chat restrictions. What you choose to do is entirely up to you.

im sorry youre just stupid. thats not an insult thats a fact. you need to go take a logic course in your local college.

1) why have chat if chat if you cant say anything negative be it toxic, passive aggressive or any other form of negativity? the world isnt always positive.

2) why have the ability to have multiple surrenders in a game if the majority speaking is final? because opinions change and spamming surrender is allowed via the in game ability to do so.

3) 1 out of 5 isnt a majority, 2 out of 5 isnt a majority. not sure where you were going with these lies.

4) stay out of my business with other people.

5) please dont comment again its obvious youre just trolling.

Halcyon is giving you good advice. You'd be wise to heed it.

Shit's not always fair, and it sucks that you got baited into a chat restriction here, but you haven't yet reached a 14-day ban and the honor hell that comes with it. Learn from your mistakes, whether or not you agree with the reasoning as to *why* they're mistakes, and you'll be fine. Carry on as you've been doing, and you're gonna wind up losing your account next time somebody ints in your game, and that would just be a needless tragedy.

o and if you think thats toxic go read the rules of the forum and then answer the OP question which wasnt "hey whats your advice on how to not get chat banned" because thats obviously dont communicate via chat you dumbass.

You don't need to avoid using chat in order to not be punished. Lots of people use chat all the time without getting punished. You just need to figure out how they are using it and replicate it.

Generally, people use chat to communicate strategies and coordinate plays, and sometimes to ask for surrenders when they are not having fun anymore.

The people who are not punished are the ones who do not do things like start arguments, act passive aggressive, or make insulting insinuations about people. It also helps to not try to force people to do what you want. They are free to make whatever decisions they like, and if they vote no on a surrender it is generally frowned upon to then complain about that vote in chat.

You literally asked why you got a 25 game chat restriction for that chat. Not only are you attacking anyone who explains it to you, but you're refusing to converse reasonably about it. It follows naturally to discuss how to avoid such restrictions.

I still bear you no ill will, and I think you'd have a better experience here if you stopped being combative. But you do you.

Also I don't see why Jo0o's comment would warrant a "fuck you" seeing as he didn't insult you in any way.

Killsquad2: go afk
Killsquad2: yep
Killsquad2: 9x on him after
you start the game flaming and the rest isnt any better. Did you have a cr before?
he threatened to go afk because he got a gank then straight up inted. id rather have an AFK than an inter. how is this toxic? youre not explaning things?

You keep talking how Bad He is that He lost the game for you that you are giving Up and going to o surrender, telling your enemys to end the game which is again giving Up. Just cause he behaves wrong doesn't give you the Ticket to be an asshole all game. You retaliated giving him the Attention He wanted, giving the fire more fuel.

the failure to explain is strong in this one. stating facts isnt being an asshole. the shaco muted me about 2 mins after he started inting. i was talkign to the team because there is litearlly no chance at winning when youre 4v5 and your 5th teammate is giving the enemy an addition 100 gold every min. on top of not stopping his lane opponent from gaining 100% of the gold uncontested. feel free to go watch the video above for proof if you dont believe it.
